conclusion: Analyze forces and use given information to calculate static friction on block D.
Four wooden blocks on a smooth surface; B and C connected by a spring; force F on B.
System consists of blocks A, B, C, and D; B and C connected by a spring; force F on B.
Blocks accelerate together due to force F and spring force.
Net force equals total mass times acceleration (F_net = (m_A + m_B + m_C + m_D) * a).
Spring force equals F, acting in the opposite direction.
Net force is F - F = 0, indicating total momentum is conserved.
Static friction force f_D must balance inertial force (m_D * a) of block D.
Using static friction equation, f_D = m_D * a.
Magnitude of static friction force f_D equals inertial force of block D.
